course_title: Spec Tops: Anthropology: Human Brain Evolution
class_notes:
(Same as IBS 500 )


This course will consider classical and modern approaches to understanding the evolution of human brain specializations. Topics to be covered will include: ideas about human cognitive and brain specializations advanced by Darwin and Huxley; the influence of the discovery of hominin brain casts; modern findings from comparative neuroanatomical studies of humans, apes, and other nonhuman primates; recent work in comparative genomics and molecular biology; and contemporary ideas about human cognitive specializations.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2242, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: T. Preuss, Status: Closed
